# CVE-2023-45046

Applications using Werkzeug to parse `multipart/form-data` requests are vulnerable to resource exhaustion. A specially crafted form body can bypass the `Request.max_form_memory_size` setting.

The `Request.max_content_length` setting, as well as resource limits provided by deployment software and platforms, are also available to limit the resources used during a request. This vulnerability does not affect those settings. All three types of limits should be considered and set appropriately when deploying an application.

# Affected Applications `BlackMarlinExec` / Master

For a relevant ongoing CVE, consider adding CVE-2024-49767, which directly impacts Werkzeug when parsing multipart/form-data requests, leading to potential resource exhaustion. This vulnerability bypasses the Request.max_form_memory_size setting, making it essential to use other safeguards, like Request.max_content_length and deployment-based resource limits, to mitigate risks.

In addition, consider CVE-2023-45046, affecting applications handling file uploads and form data, which could lead to similar issues with improperly handled memory limits. Integrating these CVEs can highlight the importance of multi-layered resource limits in your project documentation for [BlackMarlinExec](https://github.com/byt3n33dl3/BlackMarlinExec)

These vulnerabilities highlight the importance of resource limit configurations across various frameworks and parsing libraries. Adding these to your case will provide a strong foundation on the significance of configuring memory and size limits in web applications.
